client module¶

client.average(patient_id)¶

Calculates the average heart rate for each patient. This function works on all of the recorded heart rates (bmp) for a given patient.

Parameters:patient_id (str) – the patient identifier
Returns:returns a json dictionary with the average heart rate
Return type:JSON
client.get_heart_rate(patient_id)¶

Retrieves and returns all recorded heart rates for a patient

Parameters:patient_id (str) – the patient ID to which to show recorded heart rates
Returns:message showing all recorded heart rates for a patient
Return type:JSON
client.internal_average()¶

API call to calculate the average heart rate for a patient after a timestamp

This message receives a post in the following format:

{

“patient_id”: “1”,

“heart_rate_average_since”: “2018-03-09 11:00:36.372339” // date string

}

The patient ID must be entered as a string.

The date string must a string entered in the following format: “%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S.%f”

The patient’s recorded heart rates after “heart_rate_average_since” will be used for calculating an average. If there are no measurements after this point an warning is raised and the last recorded heart rate is returned.

Returns:None
client.new_patient()¶

API call to register a new patient This is called when the heart rate monitor is checked out with a new patient, and initializes the patient in the database.

An example POST:

{

“patient_id”: “1”, # usually this would be the patient MRN

“attending_email”: “suyash.kumar@duke.edu”,

“user_age”: 50, # in years

}

The patient ID must be entered as a string.

The attending email must be a string.

The patient age must be an integer.

client.post_heart_rate()¶

API call to store a heart rate measurement for a given patient. This is called to store a heart rate for a patient identified with patient_id.

An example POST:

{

“patient_id”: “1”, # usually this would be the patient MRN

“heart_rate”: 100

}

The patient ID must be entered as a string.

The heart rate must be an integer.

Returns:None
client.status(patient_id)¶

Checks and returns whether the called patient is currently tachycardic

Parameters:patient_id (str) – MRN number of the patient
Returns:dictionary with whether the patient is tachycardic and the timestamp of the last heart rate measurement
Return type:JSON
